output:
Why does cigarette smoke come from the back of the cigarette?
Why do molecules spread away from each other?
Why does a spill drop of ink never reform?
Because the universe moves towards a state of dissipation.
That is the principle of entropy.
The tendency of the universe to evolve toward a state of increasing disorder.
The principle of entropy is related to the arrow of time.
A result of the expansion of the universe.
But what will happen when gravitational forces counterbalance the forces of expansion?
Or if the energy of the quantum void proves too weak?
At that moment, the universe might enter its phase of contraction.
The big crunch.
So what will become of time?
Will it reverse?
